summary: This is an email from July 9, 2019, discussing a Daily Beast article about Jeffrey Epstein. It recounts that during Alexander Acosta's interview for U.S. Labor Secretary, he claimed he was told to back off prosecuting Epstein because Epstein 'belonged to intelligence,' leading to a controversial 2007 non-prosecution plea deal.

connections.description: Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, cut a non-prosecution plea deal with one of Epstein's attorneys, effectively ending a federal investigation into Epstein.
The Trump transition team interviewed Acosta for the position of Labor Secretary and questioned him about the Epstein case during his confirmation process.

events.title: Email Discussion of Acosta's Claims
events.description: An email is sent discussing a Daily Beast article that reveals Acosta told the Trump transition team he was instructed to back off the Epstein case because Epstein 'belonged to intelligence.'

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY (United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: Alexander Acosta claimed during his Trump transition interview that he was told Jeffrey Epstein 'belonged to intelligence' and to leave the case alone.
This directive led Acosta to cut a controversial non-prosecution plea deal with Epstein's attorney in 2007, ending a federal sex crimes investigation.
The Trump transition team found Acosta's explanation sufficient and proceeded to hire him as Labor Secretary.
The email references a Daily Beast article titled 'Jeffrey Epstein's Sick Story Played Out for Years in Plain Sight.'
The correspondence is addressed to U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman, whose office handled public corruption cases.
